payload.name: Acrobatic Strike
payload.benefit_summary: If you succeed in tumbling past a foe to avoid an AoO, gain +2 competence bonus on next attack against that foe this turn. (Errata applied)
payload.benefit_text_long: If you succeed in tumbling to avoid an attack of opportunity (see the Acrobatics skill, page 62), you gain a +5 bonus on the next attack that you make against that foe as long as the attack occurs before the end of your current turn. [Text from CRB p.83, cite: 553-554]
payload.errata_applied: CRB Errata p.290: Bonus reduced from +5 to +2 competence bonus. [cite: 2001]

payload.name: Armor Proficiency (heavy)
payload.benefit_summary: No attack or armor check penalties when wearing heavy, medium, or light armor. Gain armor's special equipment bonuses.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you wear heavy armor, you take no armor check penalty on attack rolls or skill checks. Additionally, you benefit from all of the armor's special equipment bonuses (if any). [Text from CRB p.83, cite: 554-555]
payload.normal_text: A character who wears heavy armor with which she is not proficient takes a -10 armor check penalty on attack rolls as well as skill checks made using the following skills: Acrobatics, Climb, Endurance, Initiative, Jump, Stealth, and Swim. Additionally, the character gains none of the armor's special equipment bonuses.

payload.name: Armor Proficiency (light)
payload.benefit_summary: No attack or armor check penalties when wearing light armor. Gain armor's special equipment bonuses.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you wear light armor, you take no armor check penalty on attack rolls or skill checks. Additionally, you benefit from all of the armor's special equipment bonuses (if any). [Text from CRB p.83]
payload.normal_text: A character who wears heavy armor [sic - CRB text error, should be light armor] with which she is not proficient takes a -2 armor check penalty on attack rolls as well as skill checks made using the following skills: Acrobatics, Climb, Endurance, Initiative, Jump, Stealth, and Swim. Additionally, the character gains none of the armor's special equipment bonuses.
payload.notes_for_processing: CRB text for 'Normal' section incorrectly states 'heavy armor'; it should refer to 'light armor' for this feat.

payload.name: Armor Proficiency (medium)
payload.benefit_summary: No attack or armor check penalties when wearing light or medium armor. Gain armor's special equipment bonuses.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you wear medium armor, you take no armor check penalty on attack rolls or skill checks. Additionally, you benefit from all of the armor's special equipment bonuses (if any). [Text from CRB p.83]
payload.normal_text: A character who wears medium armor with which she is not proficient takes a -5 armor check penalty on attack rolls as well as skill checks made using the following skills: Acrobatics, Climb, Endurance, Initiative, Jump, Stealth, and Swim. Additionally, the character gains none of the armor's special equipment bonuses.

payload.name: Bantha Rush
payload.benefit_summary: After successful melee attack vs opponent up to one size larger, can move that opponent 1 square as free action.
payload.benefit_text_long: After making a successful melee attack against an opponent up to one size category larger than you, you can choose to move that opponent 1 square in any direction as a free action. You can’t bantha rush an opponent that's being grabbed or grappled, and you can't bantha rush your opponent into a solid object or another creature's fighting space. [Text from CRB p.83, cite: 558-559]
payload.special_text: Unleashed: When you use the Bantha Rush feat, you can spend a Destiny Point to automatically increase the distance you move your target by 5 squares and knock your target prone. (This 'Unleashed' text is often associated with this feat, e.g. Force Unleashed Campaign Guide, though not in the CRB p.83 description itself).

payload.name: Burst Fire
payload.prerequisites_text: Proficient with heavy weapons, proficient with weapon
payload.benefit_summary: When using autofire weapon in autofire mode, can fire short burst (-5 attack, +2 dice damage) at single target. Expends 5 shots. (Errata applied)
payload.benefit_text_long: When using a ranged weapon with autofire capability in autofire mode, you may fire a short burst as a single attack against a single target. You take a -5 penalty on the attack roll but deal +2 dice of damage. For example, a weapon that deals 3d10 points of damage deals 5d10 points of damage instead. The effects of this feat do not stack with the extra damage provided by the Deadeye or Rapid Shot feat. [CRB p.83, cite: 559-560]

effects.notes: Targets a single target. Does not stack with Deadeye or Rapid Shot.

payload.normal_text: Autofire uses ten shots, targets a 2-square-by-2-square area, and can't be aimed at a specific target. Without this feat, if you attempt an autofire attack at a specific target, it simply counts as a normal attack and all the extra shots are wasted. [CRB p.83, cite: 561]
payload.special_text: Firing a burst expends five shots and can only be done if the weapon has at least five shots remaining. If you do not have a Strength of 13 or higher, increase the penalty on attacks to –10 when using this feat with non-vehicle weapons. (Errata p.290)
payload.errata_applied: Prerequisites changed from 'Str 13, Weapon Proficiency (heavy weapons), proficient with weapon' to 'Proficient with heavy weapons, proficient with weapon'. Special text added regarding STR 13.

payload.name: Careful Shot
payload.prerequisites_text: Point Blank Shot, base attack bonus +2
payload.benefit_summary: If you aim before making a ranged attack, gain +1 bonus on the attack roll.
payload.benefit_text_long: If you aim before making a ranged attack (see Aim on page 154), you gain a +1 bonus on your attack roll. [CRB p.83, cite: 561-562]

payload.name: Charging Fire
payload.benefit_summary: When charging, may make a ranged attack (no attack bonus) instead of melee. Still take -2 to Reflex Defense.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you charge, you may make a ranged attack instead of a melee attack at the end of your movement. Unlike a normal charge, your momentum does not help overcome your target, so you gain no bonus on attack roll. As with a normal charge, you still take a -2 penalty to your Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn. [CRB p.83-84, cite: 562-563]
payload.normal_text: You can make a single melee attack with a +2 bonus on your attack roll at the end of a charge. [CRB p.84, cite: 563]

payload.name: Cleave
payload.benefit_summary: If you drop an opponent with a melee attack, get an immediate extra melee attack against another opponent within reach (once per round). (Errata applied)
payload.benefit_text_long: If you deal an opponent enough damage to reduce its hit points to 0, you get an immediate extra melee attack against another opponent within your reach. The extra attack is with the same weapon and at the same bonus as the attack that dropped the previous opponent. You can use this ability once per round. [CRB p.84, cite: 563-564]
payload.special_text: Unleashed: When you deal enough damage to an opponent to reduce its hit points to 0, you can spend a Destiny Point to get an immediate extra melee attack against all opponents within your reach. This feat works in all other ways as the Cleave feat. (This 'Unleashed' text is from Force Unleashed Campaign Guide, not CRB.)
payload.errata_applied: CRB Errata p.299: Removed sentence 'You cannot adjust 1 square before making this extra attack.' [cite: 2018]

payload.name: Combat Reflexes
payload.benefit_summary: Gain additional attacks of opportunity equal to DEX modifier per round, and can make AoOs while flat-footed.
payload.benefit_text_long: When opponents leave themselves open, you may make a number of additional attacks of opportunity equal to your Dexterity modifier. For example, a character with a Dexterity of 15 can make a total of three attacks of opportunity in a round: the one attack of opportunity every character is entitled to, plus two more attacks because of his +2 Dexterity bonus. You still only make one attack of opportunity on a single opponent for a single provoking action. With this feat, you may also make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed. [CRB p.84, cite: 564-565]
payload.normal_text: A character without the Combat Reflexes feat can make only one attack of opportunity per round and can't make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed. (See Attacks of Opportunity, page 155, for more information.) [CRB p.84, cite: 565]

payload.name: Coordinated Attack
payload.benefit_summary: Automatically succeed with Aid Another action for ally's attack or to suppress enemy if target is adjacent or point blank.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are automatically successful when using the aid another action to aid an ally's attack or suppress an enemy as long as the target is adjacent to you or within point blank range. [CRB p.84, cite: 566]
payload.normal_text: You must make an attack roll against a Reflex Defense of 10 to gain the benefits of the aid another action. [CRB p.84, cite: 566]

payload.name: Crush
payload.benefit_summary: If you successfully pin an opponent with a grapple attack, can immediately deal unarmed/claw damage.
payload.benefit_text_long: If you successfully pin an opponent with a grapple attack (see the Pin feat, page 87), you can immediately deal bludgeoning damage to it equal to your unarmed damage or claw damage, whichever is greater. [CRB p.84, cite: 567]

payload.name: Cybernetic Surgery
payload.benefit_summary: Can install cybernetic prosthesis on living being (DC 20 Treat Injury, 1 hour).
payload.benefit_text_long: You can install a cybernetic prosthesis (see page 137) on a living being. The surgical procedure takes 1 hour of uninterrupted work, after which you must make on a DC 20 Treat Injury check. If the check succeeds, the prosthesis is installed correctly. If the check fails, the prosthesis is not properly installed; however, you can try again after another uninterrupted hour of surgery. [CRB p.84, cite: 567-568]

effects.details: DC 20 Treat Injury check, takes 1 hour. Failure allows retry.

payload.special_text: You can install a cybernetic prosthesis on yourself, but you take a -5 penalty on the Treat Injury skill check. If you have the Surgical Expertise feat (see page 88), you can install a cybernetic prosthesis in 10 minutes instead of 1 hour. [CRB p.85, cite: 568-569]

payload.name: Deadeye
payload.prerequisites_text: Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +4
payload.benefit_summary: If you aim before a ranged attack and hit, increase damage by one additional weapon die.
payload.benefit_text_long: If you aim before making a ranged attack (see Aim, page 154) and the attack hits, increase the damage you deal by an additional weapon die. For example, if you score a hit with a blaster pistol using the Deadeye feat, the blaster shot deals 4d6 points of damage (instead of the normal 3d6 points). The effects of this feat do not stack with the extra damage provided by the Burst Fire or Rapid Shot feat. [CRB p.85, cite: 569-570]

effects.notes: Dice type matches weapon. Does not stack with Burst Fire or Rapid Shot damage bonus.

payload.name: Dodge
payload.benefit_summary: Designate an opponent to receive a +1 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against their attacks.
payload.benefit_text_long: During your turn, you designate an opponent and receive a +1 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense against attacks from that opponent. You can select a new opponent on any action. A situation that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses. [CRB p.85, cite: 570-571]

effects.notes: Can select new opponent on any action. Lost if DEX bonus to Reflex Defense is lost. Dodge bonuses stack.

payload.name: Double Attack
payload.prerequisites_text: Base attack bonus +6, proficient with chosen weapon
payload.benefit_summary: Choose a weapon group/exotic weapon. When using full attack with it, make one additional attack, but take -5 on all attacks this turn.
payload.benefit_text_long: Choose a single exotic weapon or one of the following weapon groups: advanced melee weapons, heavy weapons, lightsabers, pistols, rifles, simple weapons. When you use the full attack action, you may make one additional attack when wielding such a weapon. However, you take a -5 penalty on all attack rolls until your next turn because you're trading precision for speed. [CRB p.85, cite: 571-572]
payload.normal_text: Making a single attack is a standard action. [CRB p.85, cite: 572]
payload.special_text: You may select this feat multiple times. Each time you select this feat, it applies to a different exotic weapon or weapon group. [CRB p.85, cite: 572]

payload.name: Dreadful Rage
payload.prerequisites_text: Rage species trait, base attack bonus +1
payload.benefit_summary: While raging, your rage bonus on melee attack and damage rolls increases to +5.
payload.benefit_text_long: While raging, your rage bonus on melee attack rolls and melee damage rolls increases to +5. [CRB p.85, cite: 572-573]
payload.normal_text: A character with the rage species trait gains a +2 rage bonus on melee attack rolls and melee damage rolls while raging. [CRB p.85, cite: 573]

payload.name: Dual Weapon Mastery I
payload.benefit_summary: When attacking with two weapons or a double weapon (full attack), take -5 penalty on all attacks instead of -10.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you attack with two weapons or with both ends of a double weapon as a part of a full attack action, you take a -5 penalty (instead of a -10 penalty) on all attack rolls until the start of your next turn. You only gain this reduced penalty if you are wielding a weapon with which you are proficient. [CRB p.85, cite: 573]
payload.normal_text: If you use a full attack action to make more than one attack on your turn (see Full Attack, page 154), you take a -10 penalty on all attack rolls for the round. [CRB p.85, cite: 574]

payload.name: Dual Weapon Mastery II
payload.prerequisites_text: Dexterity 15, base attack bonus +6, Dual Weapon Mastery I
payload.benefit_summary: When attacking with two weapons or a double weapon (full attack), take -2 penalty on all attacks instead of -10.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you attack with two weapons or both ends of a double weapon as a part of a full attack action, you take a -2 penalty (instead of a -10 penalty) on all attack rolls until the start of your next turn. You only gain this reduced penalty if you are wielding a weapon with which you are proficient. [CRB p.85, cite: 574-575]
payload.normal_text: If you use a full attack action to make more than one attack on your turn (see Full Attack, page 154), you take a -10 penalty on all attack rolls for the round. [CRB p.85, cite: 575]

payload.name: Dual Weapon Mastery III
payload.prerequisites_text: Dexterity 17, base attack bonus +11, Dual Weapon Mastery I, Dual Weapon Mastery II
payload.benefit_summary: When attacking with two weapons or a double weapon (full attack), take no penalty on attack rolls.
payload.benefit_text_long: When you wield two weapons or attack with both ends of a double weapon as a part of a full attack action, you take no penalty on your attack rolls. You only gain this benefit if you are wielding a weapon with which you are proficient. [CRB p.85, cite: 576-577]
payload.normal_text: If you use a full attack action to make more than one attack on your turn (see Full Attack, page 154), you take a -10 penalty on all attack rolls for the round. [CRB p.85, cite: 577]

payload.name: Exotic Weapon Proficiency
payload.benefit_summary: Choose one exotic weapon (e.g., bowcaster, amphistaff). You can use that weapon without penalty.
payload.benefit_text_long: Choose an exotic weapon, such as bowcaster or atlatl (see Exotic Weapons, page 119). You understand how to use that type of exotic weapon in combat. You make attack rolls with the weapon normally. [CRB p.85, cite: 577-578]

effects.notes: Benefit applies to one chosen exotic weapon.

payload.normal_text: A character who uses a weapon without being proficient with it takes a -5 penalty on attack rolls. [CRB p.85, cite: 578]
payload.special_text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a different weapon. [CRB p.85, cite: 578]

payload.name: Extra Rage
payload.benefit_summary: Can rage one additional time per day.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can fly into a rage more often. You can rage one additional time per day. [CRB p.86, cite: 578-579]
payload.special_text: You can take this feat multiple times; each time you take the feat, you can rage one additional time per day. [CRB p.86, cite: 579]

payload.name: Extra Second Wind
payload.benefit_summary: Can catch second wind one additional time per day (still only once per encounter).
payload.benefit_text_long: You tend to come back from the edge of oblivion more often. You can catch your second wind one additional time per day, but you can still only catch a second wind once per encounter (see Second Wind, page 146). [CRB p.86, cite: 579]
payload.normal_text: A hero can catch his or her second wind once per day. [CRB p.86, cite: 579]
payload.special_text: A nonheroic character that takes this feat for the first time can catch a second wind once per day. You can take this feat multiple times; each time you take this feat, you can catch a second wind one additional time per day. [CRB p.86, cite: 580]

payload.name: Far Shot
payload.benefit_summary: Range categories for ranged attacks are considered one less (e.g., short range has no penalty, medium is -2, long is -5).
payload.benefit_text_long: You are better at shooting distant foes. When you use a ranged weapon against targets at short, medium, or long range, the range category is considered one less. In other words, you take no penalty on ranged attack rolls against targets at short range, a -2 penalty on ranged attack rolls made against targets at medium range, and a -5 penalty on a ranged attack rolls made against targets at long range. [CRB p.86, cite: 580-581]
payload.normal_text: When making a ranged attack roll, a character takes a -2 penalty against targets at short range, a -5 penalty against targets at medium range, and a -10 penalty against targets at long range. [CRB p.86, cite: 581]

payload.name: Force Boon
payload.benefit_summary: Gain three additional Force Points at each level.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are able to draw upon the Force more often than less skilled users. You gain three additional Force Points at each level. [CRB p.86, cite: 581-582]

payload.name: Force Sensitivity
payload.benefit_summary: Can make Use the Force checks; Use the Force is a class skill. Can select Force Talents.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are Force-sensitive, allowing you to call on the Force and learn to draw on its power. You can make Use the Force checks, and Use the Force is considered a class skill for you. In addition, whenever you gain a new talent, you have the option of selecting a Force talent instead. You must meet the prerequisites of the Force talent to select it (see Force Talents, page 100). [CRB p.86, cite: 582-583]
payload.normal_text: You can't make Use the Force checks (page 77) or select Force talents unless you have the Force Sensitivity feat. [CRB p.86, cite: 583]

payload.name: Force Training
payload.prerequisites_text: Force Sensitivity, trained in the Use the Force skill
payload.benefit_summary: Learn Force powers equal to 1 + WIS modifier (min 1). Can select the same power multiple times.
payload.benefit_text_long: You learn one or more Force powers (see Force Powers, page 95). You add to your Force power suite a number of Force powers equal to 1 + your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1). You can add the same power more than once. [CRB p.86, cite: 583]
payload.special_text: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you take this feat, you add to your Force suite a number of new Force powers equal to 1 + your Wisdom modifier. If your Wisdom modifier permanently increases, you immediately gain a number of Force powers equal to the number of Force Training feats you have taken. (Errata p.290 clarifies the number of powers gained on taking the feat again is 1 + WIS mod). [CRB p.86, cite: 584]
payload.errata_applied: CRB Errata p.290: Benefit for taking feat multiple times clarified to '1 + your Wisdom modifier' new powers.

payload.name: Great Cleave
payload.prerequisites_text: Str 13, Power Attack, Cleave, base attack bonus +4
payload.benefit_summary: As Cleave feat, but no limit to the number of times you can use it per round.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can wield a melee weapon with such power that you can strike multiple times when you drop your opponents. As the Cleave feat (page 83), except that you have no limit to the number of times you can use it per round. [CRB p.86, cite: 584-585]

payload.name: Improved Charge
payload.benefit_summary: Can charge without moving in a straight line and can alter direction to avoid obstacles.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can charge around obstacles. You can make a charge (see page 152) without having to move in a straight line, and you can alter your direction when making a charge to avoid obstacles. All other charge rules apply. [CRB p.86, cite: 585]
payload.normal_text: A character must charge in an unobstructed straight line. [CRB p.86, cite: 585]

payload.name: Improved Damage Threshold
payload.benefit_summary: Increase your damage threshold by 5.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are harder to take down in a fight. You increase your damage threshold by 5 (see Damage Threshold, page 146). [CRB p.87, cite: 587]
payload.normal_text: A creature without this feat has a damage threshold equal to its Fortitude Defense plus its size modifier (+5 for Large, +10 for Huge, +20 for Gargantuan, or +50 for Colossal). [CRB p.87, cite: 587]
payload.special_text: You can take this feat more than once. Its effects stack. Each time you take this feat, increase your damage threshold by 5. [CRB p.87, cite: 587-588]

payload.name: Improved Defenses
payload.benefit_summary: Gain +1 bonus to Reflex, Fortitude, and Will Defense.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at fending off attacks of many forms. You gain a +1 bonus to your Reflex Defense, Fortitude Defense, and Will Defense. [CRB p.86, cite: 585]

payload.name: Improved Disarm
payload.benefit_summary: Gain +5 bonus on melee attack rolls to disarm. If you fail, opponent doesn't get a free attack.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at disarming opponents in melee combat. You gain a +5 bonus on any melee attack roll made to disarm an opponent. In addition, if you fail to disarm your opponent, he doesn't get to make a free attack against you. [CRB p.86, cite: 586]
payload.normal_text: See the normal disarm rules on page 152. [CRB p.86, cite: 586]

payload.name: Linguist
payload.benefit_summary: Gain bonus languages equal to 1 + INT modifier (min 1).
payload.benefit_text_long: You pick up languages quickly and easily. You gain a number of bonus languages equal to 1 plus your Intelligence bonus (minimum of 1). See the sidebar on page 22 for a list of common languages. [CRB p.87, cite: 588]
payload.special_text: You can take this feat more than once. Each time you take this feat, you gain a number of additional languages equal to 1 plus your Intelligence bonus (minimum of 1). [CRB p.87, cite: 588]

payload.name: Martial Arts I
payload.benefit_summary: Unarmed attack damage increases by one die step (e.g., 1d4 to 1d6). Gain +1 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are adept at fighting unarmed. Damage dealt by your unarmed attacks increases by one die step: 1d3 becomes 1d4, 1d4 becomes 1d6, and 1d6 becomes 1d8. In addition, you gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense. [CRB p.87, cite: 588-589]
payload.normal_text: The amount of damage you deal with a successful unarmed attack is based on your size: Small, 1d3; Medium, 1d4; Large, 1d6. [CRB p.87, cite: 589]
payload.special_text: A situation that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses. [CRB p.87, cite: 589-590]

payload.name: Martial Arts II
payload.prerequisites_text: Martial Arts I, base attack bonus +3
payload.benefit_summary: Unarmed attack damage increases by another die step (e.g., 1d6 to 1d8). Gain additional +1 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are a master at fighting unarmed. Damage dealt by your unarmed attacks increases by one die step: 1d4 becomes 1d6, 1d6 becomes 1d8, and 1d8 becomes 1d10. In addition, you gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense (which stacks with the dodge bonus granted by the Martial Arts I feat). [CRB p.87, cite: 590-591]

effects.stacking_note: stacks with Martial Arts I bonus

payload.normal_text: The amount of damage you deal with a successful unarmed attack is based on your size: Small, 1d3; Medium, 1d4; Large, 1d6. [CRB p.87, cite: 591]
payload.special_text: A situation that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses. [CRB p.87, cite: 591]

payload.name: Martial Arts III
payload.prerequisites_text: Martial Arts I, Martial Arts II, base attack bonus +6
payload.benefit_summary: Unarmed attack damage increases by a final die step (e.g., 1d8 to 1d10). Gain additional +1 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense.
payload.benefit_text_long: Your martial arts prowess is second to none. Damage dealt by your unarmed attacks increases by one die step: 1d6 becomes 1d8, 1d8 becomes 1d10, and 1d10 becomes 1d12. In addition, you gain a +1 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense (which stacks with the dodge bonus granted by the Martial Arts I and Martial Arts II feats). [CRB p.87, cite: 591-592]

effects.stacking_note: stacks with Martial Arts I & II bonuses

payload.normal_text: The amount of damage you deal with a successful unarmed attack is based on your size: Small, 1d3; Medium, 1d4; Large, 1d6. [CRB p.87, cite: 592]
payload.special_text: A situation that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses. [CRB p.87, cite: 592-593]

payload.name: Melee Defense
payload.benefit_summary: When making a melee attack (standard action), can take penalty up to -5 on attack and add same as dodge bonus to Reflex Defense (up to BAB). Lasts until start of next turn.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are trained at using your combat ability for defense as well as offense. When you use a standard action to make a melee attack, you can take a penalty of up to -5 on your attack roll and add the same number (up to +5) as a dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense. This number may not exceed your base attack bonus. The changes to attack rolls and Reflex Defense last until the start of your next turn. [CRB p.87, cite: 593-594]
payload.normal_text: A character without the Melee Defense feat can fight defensively while using the attack action to take a -5 penalty on his attack roll and gain a +2 dodge bonus to his Reflex Defense. [CRB p.87, cite: 594]

payload.name: Mighty Swing
payload.benefit_summary: Spend two swift actions in same round to deal +1 die of damage on next melee attack in same round.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are capable of delivering jarring melee attacks. You can spend two swift actions in the same round to deal +1 die of damage on your next melee attack in the same round. The effects of this feat do not stack with the extra damage provided by the Rapid Strike feat. [CRB p.87, cite: 595]

payload.name: Mobility
payload.benefit_summary: Gain +5 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against attacks of opportunity caused when moving out of or into a threatened area.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at moving past opponents and avoiding opportunistic attacks. You get a +5 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or into a threatened area (see Attacks of Opportunity, page 155). A situation that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most types of bonuses. [CRB p.87, cite: 595-596]

payload.name: Pin
payload.benefit_summary: If successful grapple attack and opponent fails opposed grapple check, opponent is pinned until start of your next turn.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at immobilizing grappled foes. If you succeed on a grappling attack and your opponent fails the opposed grapple check, your opponent is automatically pinned until the start of your next turn. A pinned creature can't move or take any actions while pinned, and it loses its Dexterity bonus (if any) to Reflex Defense. [CRB p.88, cite: 596-597]
payload.special_text: You cannot use the Pin and Trip feats during the same round. You can use the Pin and Crush feat in the same round, however. [CRB p.88, cite: 597]

payload.name: Point Blank Shot
payload.benefit_summary: Gain +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons against opponents within point blank range.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at making well-placed shots with ranged weapons at point blank range. You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons against opponents within point blank range (see Table 8-5: Weapon Ranges, page 129). [CRB p.88, cite: 597-598]

payload.name: Power Attack
payload.benefit_summary: Subtract from melee attack rolls to add same number to melee damage rolls (up to BAB). Bonus doubled for two-handed wielding.
payload.benefit_text_long: On your action, before making an attack roll, you may choose to subtract a number from all melee attack rolls and add the same number to all melee damage rolls. This number may not exceed your base attack bonus. The penalty on attacks and bonus on damage applies until the start of your next turn.
payload.special_text: If you attack with a two-handed weapon, or with a one-handed weapon wielded in two hands, instead add twice the number subtracted from your attack rolls. You can't add the bonus from Power Attack to the damage dealt against an object or vehicle.

payload.name: Powerful Charge
payload.prerequisites_text: Medium or larger size, base attack bonus +1
payload.benefit_summary: When you charge, gain an additional +2 to melee attack roll and deal extra damage equal to 1/2 your level.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can charge with extra force. When you charge, you gain an additional +2 bonus to your melee attack roll. If your melee attack hits, you deal additional damage equal to one-half your level.

payload.name: Precise Shot
payload.benefit_summary: No -5 penalty for shooting or throwing a ranged weapon at an opponent engaged in melee with an ally.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at timing your ranged attacks so that you don't hit your allies by mistake. You can shoot or throw a ranged weapon at an opponent engaged in melee combat with one or more of your allies without taking the standard -5 penalty (see Shooting or Throwing into a Melee, page 161).

payload.name: Quick Draw
payload.benefit_summary: Draw or holster a weapon as a swift action instead of a move action.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can draw and holster weapons with startling quickness. You can draw or holster a weapon as a swift action instead of as a move action.

payload.name: Rapid Shot
payload.prerequisites_text: Base attack bonus +1, proficient with weapon
payload.benefit_summary: With a ranged weapon, fire two shots as a single attack (-2 attack penalty, +1 die damage). Expends 2 shots. (Errata applied)
payload.benefit_text_long: You can make two quick shots with a ranged weapon as a single attack. When using a ranged weapon, you may fire two shots as a single attack against a single target. You take a -2 penalty on your attack roll, but you deal +1 die of damage with a successful attack.
payload.special_text: Using this feat fires two shots and can only be done if the weapon has sufficient ammunition remaining. The effects of this feat do not stack with the extra damage provided by the Burst Fire feat (page 82) or Deadeye feat (page 84). If you do not have a Strength of 13 or higher, increase the penalty to attacks to –5 when using this feat with non-vehicle weapons. (Errata p.290 [cite: 2003])
payload.errata_applied: Strength prerequisite removed. Special text added regarding STR 13 for penalty with non-vehicle weapons.

payload.name: Rapid Strike
payload.prerequisites_text: Base attack bonus +1, proficient with weapon
payload.benefit_summary: With a melee weapon, make two strikes as a single attack (-2 attack penalty, +1 die damage). (Errata applied)
payload.benefit_text_long: You can make two quick strikes with a melee weapon as a single attack. When using a melee weapon, you may make two strikes as a single attack against a single target. You take a -2 penalty on your attack roll, but you deal +1 die of damage with a successful attack. The effects of this feat do not stack with the extra damage provided by the Mighty Swing feat.
payload.special_text: If you do not have a Dexterity of 13 or higher, increase the penalty to attacks to –5 when using this feat with non-light weapons. (Errata p.290)
payload.errata_applied: Dexterity prerequisite removed. Special text added regarding DEX 13 for penalty with non-light weapons.

payload.name: Running Attack
payload.benefit_summary: When making a melee or ranged attack, can move both before and after the attack (total distance not greater than speed).
payload.benefit_text_long: You can move as you attack. When making an attack with a melee or ranged weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed.

payload.name: Shake It Off
payload.benefit_summary: Spend two swift actions (instead of three) to move +1 step along the condition track.
payload.benefit_text_long: You have learned to shake off debilitating conditions. You can spend two swift actions instead of three swift actions to move +1 step along the condition track (see Conditions, page 148).
payload.normal_text: It takes three swift actions to move +1 step along the condition track.

payload.name: Skill Focus
payload.benefit_summary: Gain +5 competence bonus on skill checks with one chosen trained skill.
payload.benefit_text_long: One of your skills is particularly well honed. You gain a +5 competence bonus on skill checks made with one trained skill of your choice.
payload.special_text: This feat may be selected multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a different trained skill.

payload.name: Skill Training
payload.benefit_summary: Choose one untrained skill from your list of class skills; you become trained in it.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are considered trained in a new skill. Choose one untrained skill from your list of class skills. You become trained in that skill.
payload.special_text: This feat may be selected multiple times. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a different class skill.

payload.name: Sniper
payload.prerequisites_text: Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +4
payload.benefit_summary: Always ignore soft cover when making a ranged attack.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are particularly adept at hitting the right target in a crowd. You always ignore soft cover (that is, cover provided by a character, creature, or droid) when you make a ranged attack.
payload.normal_text: You can only ignore cover if you aim (see page 154) before making a ranged attack.

payload.name: Strong in the Force
payload.benefit_summary: When spending a Force Point to adjust attack, skill, or ability check results, roll d8s instead of d6s.
payload.benefit_text_long: You have a particularly strong connection to the Force. When you spend a Force Point to adjust the result of an attack roll, skill check, or ability check, you roll d8s rather than d6s.

payload.name: Surgical Expertise
payload.benefit_summary: Can perform surgery in 10 minutes instead of 1 hour.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can perform skillful surgical procedures quickly. You can perform surgery in 10 minutes.
payload.normal_text: Performing surgery typically takes 1 hour (see the Treat Injury skill, page 74).

payload.name: Throw
payload.benefit_summary: If you successfully trip an opponent with a grapple attack, can throw them prone up to 1 square beyond reach, dealing unarmed damage.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can throw a creature that you've grappled. If you successfully trip an opponent with a grapple attack, the opponent falls prone in any unoccupied space you desire up to 1 square beyond your reach and takes bludgeoning damage equal to your unarmed attack damage. A thrown opponent is no longer considered grappled.

payload.name: Toughness
payload.benefit_summary: Gain +1 hit point per character level.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are tougher than normal. You gain +1 hit point per character level.

payload.name: Trip
payload.benefit_summary: If successful grapple attack and opponent fails opposed grapple check, opponent falls prone and is no longer grappled.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are skilled at tripping grappled foes. If you succeed on a grappling attack (see page 153) and your opponent fails the opposed grapple check, it falls prone in its space and is no longer considered grappled. A prone opponent takes a -5 penalty on melee attack rolls. Melee attacks made against a prone target gain a +5 bonus, while ranged attacks made against a prone target take a -5 penalty.
payload.special_text: You cannot use the Pin and Trip feats during the same round.

payload.name: Triple Attack
payload.prerequisites_text: Base attack bonus +11, Double Attack (chosen weapon), proficient with chosen weapon
payload.benefit_summary: Choose a weapon group/exotic weapon (same as Double Attack). With full attack, make a second additional attack (-5 penalty on all attacks, stacks with Double Attack penalty).
payload.benefit_text_long: You can make an additional attack during a round of combat. Choose a single exotic weapon or one of the following weapon groups: advanced melee weapons, heavy weapons, lightsabers, pistols, rifles, simple weapons. When you use the full attack action, you may make one additional attack when wielding such a weapon. However, you take a -5 penalty on all attack rolls until your next turn because you're trading precision for speed. The extra attack and penalty stack with those of Double Attack.

effects.notes: This is an additional attack on top of Double Attack. Total penalty when using both is -10.

payload.normal_text: Making a single attack is a standard action.
payload.special_text: You may select this feat multiple times. Each time you select this feat, it applies to a different exotic weapon or weapon group.

payload.name: Triple Crit
payload.prerequisites_text: Proficient with weapon, base attack bonus +8
payload.benefit_summary: Choose one weapon type (e.g., blaster pistol, lightsaber, unarmed). Deal triple damage on a critical hit with that weapon.
payload.benefit_text_long: Choose one type of weapon, such as a blaster pistol, vibrodagger, or lightsaber. You deal more damage on a critical hit with that weapon. When you score a critical hit with the selected weapon, you deal triple damage. You may select “unarmed attack” as a weapon for purposes of this feat.
payload.normal_text: A critical hit normally deals double damage to the target.
payload.special_text: You can gain this feat multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take this feat, it applies to a different weapon.

payload.name: Vehicular Combat
payload.benefit_summary: Once per round as reaction when piloting, negate a weapon hit on vehicle with successful Pilot check (DC = attack roll). Proficient with pilot-operated vehicle weapons.
payload.benefit_text_long: You can avoid attacks made against your vehicle. Once per round (as a reaction), when you are piloting a vehicle or starship, you may negate a weapon hit by making a successful Pilot check. The DC of the skill check is equal to the result of the attack roll you wish to negate. In addition, while you are piloting a vehicle, you are considered proficient with pilot-operated vehicle weapons. (The vehicle descriptions in Chapter 10 indicate which weapons are operated by the pilot.)

payload.name: Weapon Finesse
payload.benefit_summary: Use DEX modifier instead of STR modifier on attack rolls with light melee weapons and lightsabers.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are especially skilled at using weapons one that can benefit as much from Dexterity as from Strength. When using a light melee weapon or a lightsaber, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls.

payload.name: Weapon Focus
payload.benefit_summary: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group (unarmed/grapple possible). Gain +1 bonus on attack rolls with it.
payload.benefit_text_long: Choose a single exotic weapon or weapon group. You are especially good at using these weapons. You can choose unarmed strike or grapple for your weapon for purposes of this feat. You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected exotic weapon or weapon group.
payload.special_text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new exotic weapon or weapon group. (Errata p.299 removed 'Delete the third sentence under the Weapon Focus header.' - this sentence isn't present in CRB p.89 text).
payload.errata_applied: Prerequisite changed from 'Proficiency with weapon' to 'Proficient with chosen weapon'.

payload.name: Weapon Proficiency
payload.benefit_summary: Choose a weapon group (advanced melee, heavy, lightsabers, pistols, rifles, simple). Proficient with all weapons in that group.
payload.benefit_text_long: You are proficient with a particular kind of weaponry. Choose one of the following weapon groups: advanced melee weapons, heavy weapons (which includes vehicular weapons and starship weapons), lightsabers, pistols, rifles, and simple weapons. You are proficient with all weapons of the selected group. For more information on weapon groups, see page 119.
payload.normal_text: If you wield a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a -5 penalty to your attack rolls.
payload.special_text: You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a different weapon group. You cannot take exotic weapons as a weapon group; instead, you must select the Exotic Weapon Proficiency feat (see page 84) to gain proficiency with a specific exotic weapon (such as the bowcaster or flamethrower).

payload.name: Whirlwind Attack
payload.prerequisites_text: Dex 13, Int 13, Melee Defense, base attack bonus +4
payload.benefit_summary: As a full-round action, make an area attack with melee weapon, striking every target within reach (one attack roll applied to all). (Errata applied)
payload.benefit_text_long: You can strike nearby opponents in an amazing, spinning melee attack. As a full-round action, you can make an area attack with your melee weapon, striking every opponent within your reach. This whirlwind attack uses the area attack rules (see Area Attacks, page 155); you make one attack roll and apply the result to every target in range.
payload.special_text: Unleashed: When you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you can spend a Destiny Point to gain a +5 bonus on your attack roll and knock prone any targets you damage. (This 'Unleashed' text is from Force Unleashed Campaign Guide, not CRB.)
payload.errata_applied: CRB Errata p.290: Changed 'opponent' to 'target' in benefit description.
